results.title: Bill
results.creator_credit: Alan Landsburg Productions, Mel Stuart and Anthony Page
results.brief_description: Bill, a 40 year old intellectually disabled man, must learn to survive the harsh realities of New York City or be recommitted to an institution for the rest of his life. He can neither read nor write and his child-like gentleness and innocence make him an easy target for hurt or rejection.

results.title: Bilingual kids
results.creator_credit: Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development and James Mann
results.brief_description: This program is designed to introduce teachers, parents and communities to the concept of bilingual education. It looks at processes involved in the implementation of the Greek:English Bilingual Pilot Project in the Richmond-Collingwood area. A number of evaluation findings are also discussed

results.title: Bilderbuch fur Ernst Will
results.material_description: Single channel moving image, colour and audio
results.brief_description:
The most complex and multi-layered of Callas’ CVI works, ‘Bilderbuch’ focuses on the geographic continent and turbulent political history of Europe. The primary image source of the work is a children’s wartime pictorial scrapbook (or ‘bilderbuch’). Callas has described ‘Bilderbuch fur Ernst Will’ as an ‘electronic rendering of a form of proto-televisual iconomania’, involving the collecting and collating of seemingly random images which, when seen together, reveal underlying narratives and belief systems.

Seen in this context, images from the child’s scrapbook come together to create a startling picture of wartime Europe and its legacy.
Notes by Rachel Kent, reprinted courtesy of the author and d/Lux Media Arts.

results.title: Bike style
results.brief_description: Two couples discover the joys of a summer holiday travelling by bicycles through Yugoslavia. The challenge of the trip, the opportunity of meeting people and the personal satisfaction are highlighted.
results.description: Two couples discover the joys of a summer holiday travelling by bicycles through Yugoslavia. The challenge of the trip, the opportunity of meeting people and the personal satisfaction are highlighted.

results.title: Bike people
results.creator_credit: Charles Cahill and Associates and Phil Kassel
results.brief_description: More and more people are riding bikes today, and here the basic safety precautions, optional equipment and protection against theft are discussed. The film explains bike vehicle code rules which are designed to make riding safe and fun, and points out that equipment can add to safe riding.

results.title: Bike ed in action; be seen to be safe.
results.creator_credit: Materials production, Education Dept, Bike Ed, Ivan Gaal, David Ferris, Mark Laughlin and Jeff Spencer
results.brief_description: This compilation tape consists of two programs covering various aspects of bicycle safety. “Bike ed in action” highlights the alarming accident rate among Victorian cyclists and reviews the Bike Education Curriculum Unit which aims to develop positive cycling safety skills. Basic cycling safety measures are demonstrated. “Be seen to be safe” looks at some of the precautions young cyclists must take to ensure that they are seen at night.

results.title: Bighorn: Rocky Mountain bighorn sheep, Banff and Jasper National Parks
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Bill Brind and Bill Schmalz
results.brief_description: A far closer view, and a more complete one, than even the hardiest and most patient of visitors is likely to get of the bighorn mountain sheep of the Canadian Rocky Mountains. “Bighorn” is a film distinguished by its camerawork (Bill Schmalz). It catches the characteristic behavior of the bighorns from birth to mating time. Few animals are more arresting in appearance or activity than these dancers of the high ledges. Awards: Novi Sad; Spindleruv Mlyn; Philadelphia; Tarbes.

results.title: Bighorn!
results.creator_credit: Tomorrow Entertainment, Eleanor Riger and Robert Riger
results.brief_description: Hosted by John Denver, this program considers the habitat and behavior of the Rocky Mountain bighorn sheep and shows how the lives of the sheep are being threatened by the activities of man. Denver speaks and sings of the oneness with the world he feels during his trip through the mountains and of how people must relearn to respect nature, her laws and inhabitants. The trip covers the period from early spring through winter, and many animals are glimpsed and discussed. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Bighorn!
results.brief_description: Focuses on problems facing wildlife and wilderness areas in the United States. Gives the history of the Rocky Mountain bighorn sheep and describes its relationship to its environment. This film was made with the assistance of Yellowstone National Park, Glacier National Park and Grand Teton National Park.

results.title: Bigger, faster, stronger
results.creator_credit: Brigham Young University, W O. Whitaker and Scott Whitaker
results.brief_description: Narrated by world discus thrower, L. Jay Sylvester, tells how weight training is used to produce bigger, faster, stronger athletes. Features championship high school, college and professional athletes, and shows that sucess in athletics come only to who make a real commitment.
